docs.abstract: Revisiting the blistering criticism from President Trump’s own party raises questions about whether the search for a killer line on Mr. Trump is a fool’s errand for Democrats in 2020.
docs.snippet: Revisiting the blistering criticism from President Trump’s own party raises questions about whether the search for a killer line on Mr. Trump is a fool’s errand for Democrats in 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has called President Trump an “existential threat” to the nation.

headline.main: No One Attacked Trump More in 2016 Than Republicans. It Didn’t Work.
headline.print_headline: Democrats Seek an Apt Retort; Republicans Tried Them All

docs.abstract: The White House is seeking reauthorization of a law that lets the N.S.A. gain access to logs of Americans’ phone and text records — while acknowledging that the program has been indefinitely halted.
docs.snippet: The White House is seeking reauthorization of a law that lets the N.S.A. gain access to logs of Americans’ phone and text records — while acknowledging that the program has been indefinitely halted.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Breaking a long silence about a high-profile National Security Agency program that sifts records of Americans’ telephone calls and text messages in search of terrorists, the Trump administration on Thursday acknowledged for the first time that the system has been indefinitely shut down — but asked Congress to extend its legal basis anyway.

headline.main: Trump Administration Asks Congress to Reauthorize N.S.A.’s Deactivated Call Records Program
headline.print_headline: White House Asks to Reauthorize Surveillance of Americans’ Phone Data

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

docs.abstract: Lawmakers say President Trump’s disregard for their authority leaves them no choice but to use the courts with greater frequency, but that could have constitutional consequences.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers say President Trump’s disregard for their authority leaves them no choice but to use the courts with greater frequency, but that could have constitutional consequences.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Democrats took control of the House this year promising to use legislation and investigations to check President Trump. But facing substantial roadblocks to each, they are increasingly opposing him in a different way: Eight months into their majority, the House is going to court at a tempo never seen before.

headline.main: The House v. Trump: Stymied Lawmakers Increasingly Battle in the Courts
headline.print_headline: House v. Trump: A Surge in Lawsuits That’s ‘Like Nothing Else in History’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Charlie Savage and Nicholas Fandos

docs.abstract: But with Republicans in charge of the Senate and President Trump in the White House, an assault weapons ban has little chance of being signed into law before 2021.
docs.snippet: But with Republicans in charge of the Senate and President Trump in the White House, an assault weapons ban has little chance of being signed into law before 2021.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Twenty-five years ago, Democratic support for an assault weapons ban was a major reason the party lost control of the House. Now top Democrats want to revive the fight.

headline.main: Democrats Want to Revive a Ban on Assault Weapons
headline.print_headline: Reviving Fight, Top Democrats  Push Ban on Assault Weapons

docs.abstract: The president is facing pushback from gun rights advocates and some of his advisers. But he could follow his pattern of abruptly dropping the idea of doing something after talking about it for weeks.
docs.snippet: The president is facing pushback from gun rights advocates and some of his advisers. But he could follow his pattern of abruptly dropping the idea of doing something after talking about it for weeks.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — He has called Senator Christopher S. Murphy, a Democrat from Connecticut, where 26 people were gunned down at an elementary school. He has reached out to Senator Joe Manchin III, Democrat of West Virginia, and Senator Patrick J. Toomey, Republican of Pennsylvania, who sponsored a bill extending background checks that the Senate defeated in 2014.

headline.main: Trump Weighs Action on Gun Control. But It’s Still a Theoretical Discussion.
headline.print_headline: Door Opens for Action On Guns, but President  Pauses at the Threshold

byline.original: By Maggie Haberman, Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Jonathan Martin

docs.abstract: A report from the House Oversight Committee disclosed new details of how Thomas Barrack, a close friend of the president’s, sought to employ his influence.
docs.snippet: A report from the House Oversight Committee disclosed new details of how Thomas Barrack, a close friend of the president’s, sought to employ his influence.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Twelve days after President Trump was sworn in and five days after he roiled the Arab world with his first effort to restrict the entry of people from many predominantly Muslim countries to the United States, Thomas J. Barrack Jr., a close friend of the president’s and a top fund-raiser for his campaign, had an idea for the White House.

headline.main: Trump Adviser Said to Have Pursued Saudi Nuclear Deal as He Sought Administration Role
headline.print_headline: House Report Finds Conflicts In Trump Donor’s Proposals

keywords.value: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

docs.abstract: A federal judge found that Russia was immune from liability in an American court.
docs.snippet: A federal judge found that Russia was immune from liability in an American court.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge in Manhattan on Monday dismissed a lawsuit by the Democratic National Committee that had accused President Trump’s 2016 campaign, WikiLeaks and Russia of illegally conspiring to damage Hillary Clinton’s presidential run.

headline.main: Democrats’ Lawsuit Alleging Trump-Russia Conspiracy Is Dismissed
headline.print_headline: D.N.C. Lawsuit About Election Is Dismissed

docs.abstract: Democrats and former officials also expressed concern that the pick, Representative John Ratcliffe, will politicize what is supposed to be a nonpartisan job.
docs.snippet: Democrats and former officials also expressed concern that the pick, Representative John Ratcliffe, will politicize what is supposed to be a nonpartisan job.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republicans hesitated on Monday to embrace President Trump’s choice for the director of national intelligence, and some privately expressed doubts about his potential confirmation, echoing concerns of experts and Democrats that he was too inexperienced and too partisan.

headline.main: Republican Senators Are Cool to Trump’s Choice for Top Intelligence Post
headline.print_headline: Pick for Head Of Intelligence Faces Hurdles

byline.original: By Julian E. Barnes, Nicholas Fandos and Adam Goldman

docs.abstract: Baltimore residents know their city has deep, ugly problems. But they say President Trump’s race-baiting insults are not going to help Charm City.
docs.snippet: Baltimore residents know their city has deep, ugly problems. But they say President Trump’s race-baiting insults are not going to help Charm City.
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — The last time Donald J. Trump blamed a black man for the condition of this undoubtedly troubled city, the year was 2015, the death of Freddie Gray in police custody had spawned a racial uprising, and the black man in question was President Barack Obama.

headline.main: Baltimore to Trump: You Lost Your Authority to Criticize
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Becomes Used To Playing Trump’s Foil

docs.abstract: House Democrats left Washington for the summer with a long list of symbolic victories, but an even longer one of unfulfilled goals.
docs.snippet: House Democrats left Washington for the summer with a long list of symbolic victories, but an even longer one of unfulfilled goals.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On their 100th day in power, they squabbled about spending as President Trump assailed one of the first Muslims in Congress with a video of the Sept. 11 attacks.

headline.main: Heading Into Long Recess, House Democrats Take Home a Mixed Record
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Head Into Their August Recess With a Mixed Record
